title: Czech Republic - Factors To Watch on Oct 7
text: PRAGUE, Oct 7 (Reuters) - Here are news stories, press reports and events to watch which may affect Czech financial markets on Monday. Previous stories on Czech data............. **For a schedule of corporate and economic events: http://emea1.apps.cp.thomsonreuters.com/Apps/CountryWeb/#/2E/events-overview ============================NEWS/EVENTS======================== DATA: Statistics office to release industry and foreign trade data. (0700 GMT) RATINGS: Moody's Upgrades Czech Republic's Ratings To AA3, Changes Outlook To Stable From Positive CEZ: Czech utility CEZ would keep its assets in Bulgaria if the country's regulator blocks a sale to domestic firm Eurohold , CEZ board member Tomas Pleskac was quoted as saying on Friday by CTK news agency. CENBANK: The Czech National Bank board expects to return to a debate on raising interest rates at its next policy meeting, when it has new staff forecasts, minutes from its Sept. 25 meeting showed. The bank voted 5-2 at the meeting to leave its two-week repo rate unchanged at 2.00%. Vice-Governor Marek Mora and board member Vojtech Benda backed a 25-basis-point increase, according to the minutes, released on Friday. CEE FX POLL: Central Europe's leading currencies should firm against the euro over the next year, lifted by solid growth once global worries calm, although the expected gains will be less than previously forecast, a Reuters poll showed on Friday. CEE MARKETS: Polish stocks led mild regional gains on Friday after a court ruling seen less unfavourable to the country's financial sector than expected pulled prices higher, with some bank stocks jumping as much as 5 percent. EUROPE POWER: European baseload electricity prices for delivery early next week registered strong gains in wholesale trade on Friday, buoyed by a forecast drop in wind power generation and a demand upturn in Germany. ---------------------- MARKET SNAPSHOT ------------------------ Index/Crown Currency Latest Prev Pct change Pct change close on day in 2019 vs Euro 25.725 25.719 -0.02 -0.11 vs Dollar 23.438 23.419 -0.08 -4.56 Czech Equities 1,004.56 1,004.56 -0.09 1.82 U.S. Equities 26,573.72 26,201.04 1.42 13.92 Pvs close or current levels vs prior domestic close at 1500 GMT ===========================PRESS DIGEST========================= WAGES: The average Czech wage have more than doubled since 2000 compared to a 44% rise in German wages, a study Purple Trading found.
